messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba motif legend...
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks mates...interesting reference to the shrine, too! Appreciate the help, as always! ... From: Barry Thomas To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com Sent: Sunday,
messages.messageBody:
Thanks mates...interesting reference to the shrine, too! Appreciate the help, as always!

----- Original Message -----
From: Barry Thomas
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, March 30, 2008 10:10 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba motif legend...


Gordon Robson wrote:

> I don't know if there is an accompanying story.

From: http://www.asahi-net.or.jp/~QM9T-KNDU/jochiji.htm

Idaten {e-dah-ten}, or Skanda in Skt., one of the many guardian deities for the Lord Buddha known as a swift-runner. Legend asserts that he runs so fast that he was able to catch the thieves who stole Sakyamuni's ashes. Statues of Idaten are often installed in kitchens or priests' living quarter of Zen temples. The statue is 87 centimeters tall and was carved in the 14th century. Sculptors unknown. Both are ICAs designated by the City of Kamakura.

Regards,
Barry Thomas.

----- Original Message -----
From: ROBSON Gordon
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, March 31, 2008 12:29 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba motif legend...

Hi Ron,

There is a famous set of menuki with this theme by Goto Yujo. One is in the Maeda
collection and the other is in a private collection. In Japanese the motif is called
Idaten Ki or swift running heavenly warrior and demon. I don't know if there is an
accompanying story.

Gordon

.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba motif legend...
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Barry, The temple looks pretty cool. I ll have to pay a visit.
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Barry,

The temple looks pretty cool. I'll have to pay a visit.

messages.subject: Tsuba motif legend...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all - Good time to see if anyone exists out there...no messages for several days? What is the name of the story depicting a warrior chasing an oni who has
messages.messageBody:
Hi all -

Good time to see if anyone exists out there...no messages for several days?

What is the name of the story depicting a warrior chasing an oni who has stolen his stupa (shrine)? I used to know this but can't locate that info anywhere.

Ron
STL

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
